text: Question for Digital Asset people : do canton client (participant mostly I suppose) obey Proxy related ENV variables ? (to use an egress HTTP(s) proxy)

elements.text: Question for Digital Asset people : do canton client (participant mostly I suppose) obey Proxy related ENV variables ? (to use an egress HTTP(s) proxy)

text: Because either it supports it or we'll have to build another solution as k8s by default in our env uses each node public IP for egress

elements.text: Because either it supports it or we'll have to build another solution as k8s by default in our env uses each node public IP for egress

text: Well, got actually 1 devnet & 1 mainnet, both deployed with docker-compose. But as we're on OVH right now, using their Managed kubernetes, the easiest way I see with their solution is to build a second cluster with private addressing only and gateway for all egress. That means a new K8S cluster just for Canton nodes

elements.text: Well, got actually 1 devnet & 1 mainnet, both deployed with docker-compose. But as we're on OVH right now, using their Managed kubernetes, the easiest way I see with their solution is to build a second cluster with private addressing only and gateway for all egress. That means a new K8S cluster just for Canton nodes

text: As we agree a real prod target env is K8S based I suppose

text: I don't see the issue with gRPC and outgoing proxy as long as proper HTTP headers are kept and connections are kept sticky to one proxy

elements.text: I don't see the issue with gRPC and outgoing proxy as long as proper HTTP headers are kept and connections are kept sticky to one proxy

During this time you’ll be able to add your Validator to the network, but minting will not begin until the end of the two hour window.

text: Asking for a helm chart change for validator : it seems the migration uses a PVC with name which is hardcoded. Which means the only way to have several validators in the same cluster is to play with namespace

elements.text: Asking for a helm chart change for validator : it seems the migration uses a PVC with name which is hardcoded. Which means the only way to have several validators in the same cluster is to play with namespace

text:
```charts/tmp/splice-validator/templates/validator.yaml-369-metadata:
charts/tmp/splice-validator/templates/validator.yaml-370-  name: "domain-migration-validator-pvc"
charts/tmp/splice-validator/templates/validator.yaml-371-  namespace: {{ $.Release.Namespace }}```

Hi everyone, I am trying to figure out the best way to validate if my IP is whitelisted or not. Would the inability to query
```curl -X POST SPONSOR_SV_URL/api/sv/v0/devnet/onboard/validator/prepare ```
for the sponsor SV URL that we have be an indicator that the IP I am trying to query this from is not whitelisted and needs that step.
Would really appreciate guidance on the same. Thank you
